subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to write the assertion?
msgSnippet: ... Bob, Thank you for un-lurking.  I think I could learn something from your experience.  I m not sure, though, if your response was directly to J.B. s
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> In many cases, when programmers don't test their own code, they deliver
> such low quality work that testers spend their time writing and running
> trivial test cases, driving out silly bugs, rather than being allowed to
> spend their time writing interesting tests, driving out the kinds of
> bugs that drive customers crazy.
Bob Bondi wrote:
> As a professional QA person with over 20 years hand-on experience it
> is my sad duty to report that the schema for testing being discussed
> is a set-back to quality. [...] The problem is (especially in Agile
> methods) the time for QA has been cut drastically. The need for
> integration testing is greater than ever before, but the time QA has
> for that activity is reduced to such short periods that that type of
> testing is relegated to last, IMHO.
Bob,

Thank you for un-lurking. I think I could learn something from your
experience. I'm not sure, though, if your response was directly to
J.B.'s comment, or to the tone of discussion in general. J.B. suggests
that if programmers don't test their own code, it wastes QA time. Are
you saying that if programmers don't test their own code, they get it to
QA quicker, giving more time for effective QA?

Thanks again,

David Saff
